Posts.Content: Hi Amy I had my mastectomy 1st Dec 15. I would recommend wearing comfy easy clothes to wear. I also had a shoulder bag that I could fit my drain into.. mine was the left side and although I  coped ok i did have restricted movement.... i know your going to worry but for me it was the unknown every time... the operation willl be over before you know it... try to stay calm good luck for thursday will be thinking of you... sending best wishes. Lou xx
Posts.Title: Practical post mastectomy stuff

Posts.Content: Hi was wondering if anyone suffers from joint pain from letrozole at what degree ? I've only been on it for 4 months and suffering really badly I'm interested particularly with the ladies that have taken it for a year plus. How do you cope or do you just keep trying a brand until one suits ? I know the importance of the med but not sure how much pain to expect.. Take care Lou xxx
Posts.Title: Letrozole - hair thinning

Posts.Content: Hi mumt my heart goes out to you.... my diagnosis was similar to yrs only I had mastectomy straight away as opposed to yr lumpectomy. It's a very scary and worrying time for all of us.. my op was delayed by 4 weeks because I was also diagnosed with angina at the same time I thought every ache and pain meant it had spread I started to have panic attacks and anxiety.. my mx was 1st Dec and I think I have come to terms with it all now. I'm starting back to work tomorrow im a manager of a preschool and really looking forward to working again with my lovely staff and children but feel a bit nervous... my advice to you would be take one day at a time and chose to do what is right for you. Good luck for Tuesday.  Lou
Posts.Title: Terrified..MX on Tuesday

Posts.Content: Today was a wonderful day I'm a manager of a preschool which I adore .. since my mastectomy Dec 15 and other health problems my life had spiraled out of control I had lost all my confidence and really didn't thing I would get it back !!! But today we celebrated counties from around the world the parents brought in a dish from home to share and I actually without even thinking abt it did a welcome speech !!!! For me it was such a big step I think I'm on the road to some sort of normal  !!!! Just goes to show yesterday I was a moaning minnie and today I'm happy as Larry !!!! Lol Always looking forward to the future... Have a good weekend everyone. Lou xxxxx
Posts.Title: Proud of myself !!!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone it's been a funny old day today it's been a year since I was diagnosed. I suddenly realised I hadn't filled in the calendar with families birthdays so looked bk at my old one from last year and it all came flooding back the appointments, the mx etc very surreal.. got 1st mamagram soon and 2nd 6 monthly check up with surgeons team that will be nerve racking... I wish I could say I'm nearly back to my old self but obviously im not with the side effects from letrozole , having physio for my shoulder and got appointment in 2 weeks for cardiology dept which has taken a year !!! But having said all that I really do feel better in myself in a funny sort of way... I think I really am feeling positive about the future without making myself cos thats what everyone tells me to do !!!  Have a lovely weekend.  Sending my best wishes to you all. Love lou xxx
Posts.Title: One year on !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi galarussett hope your ok. You really do need to take someone with you tomorrow. Let's hope it's good news but for most of us it's very overwhelming and for me a real shock to be told I had bc and needed a mastectomy! !! Thinking of you tomorrow.  Take care here's hoping for good news for you. Lou xx
Posts.Title: Waiting is nearly over

Posts.Content: Hello ladies i happen to go to a different chemist today to pick up letrozole and was given a different brand.. ive now had accord , teva now Ive been given Pom !!! I do suffer with aches and pains put it's doable and a small price to pay for the good it is doing... but still feel apprehensive starting a new tablet I know we're all different but wondered if anyone has tired this brand.. Their proberly all the cheaper brands.. !!! Lol Here's to pain free days. Lou xx
Posts.Title: New brand of letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi ceecee That's great I'm defo going to get some   I need a miracle !!! Lol Lou xx
Posts.Title: Letrazole side effect

Posts.Content: Hi ceecee hope yr ok.  That's an interesting question that I would like to know the answer to... I'm on letrozole and been married for 34 years everything had been great in that department until I hit menopause for which I used oestrogen cream but as u say I can't use that anymore, our sex life has gone on the back burner whilst I still have my health issues and my husband seems ok abt it but I'm 57 and not ready to give up my sex life yet !!! Lol Hope someone responds with a magic cure !!! Lol Take care  Lou xxx
Posts.Title: Letrazole side effect

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca ive been on letrozole for 6 months now and was fairly happy with the last one I've been taking teva.... ive had terrible side effects from a few different brands my oncologist said it should settle down soon I've been hoping to talk to someone who's been on them longer and was wondering is that the case ? I normally get mine from a small local chemist but they didn't have any in stock so went to boots in the hight street I really thought I would beable to have the pick of brands but could you believe it they were literally sold out of all brands !!!! My local chemist said I'm unable to order my brand..... unbelievable! !!  How are you after 4 years ? Lou xxxx
Posts.Title: Letrazole - side effects after four years

Posts.Content: Hi ladies letrozole for other 9 years 6 months !!! Or 14 years 6 months !!!! Now that's a tough one !!! Lol yes I'm really hoping new treatment in 3 years time... Sorry just had to say that hope your all well.. Lou xx
Posts.Title: AI's for up to 15 yrs

Posts.Content: Hi dreamthief thank you for your reply..... ok will call them on mon.... yes I know the importance of taking alendronic but I already suffer with bad reflux and I'm sure this tablet has made it worse.  Im awaiting results of 2 biopsy taken whilst having the proceedure of the camera down my throat I have hiatal hernia as well.... is there medication in injection form available do you know ?  Hope Jackie is doing well. Thank you Lou xxxx
Posts.Title: 1st routine mammogram and alandrolic tablet

Posts.Content: Hi I've had my 1st year routine mammogram the nurse said I should hear in 2 weeks well it's been 3 and half and I still haven't heard anything I've got my 2nd 6 month check up with the surgeon or one of he's team on Thursday so I'm starting to get worried that something is wrong and they're leaving it for him to tell me... any thoughts from anyone would be appreciated.    Also the weekly alandrolic tablet I'm taking is really giving me bad acid reflux I asked my gp if I could have it in an injection form but she said it's to expensive. .... is anyone else having side effect from these. Thanks lou xxxxx
Posts.Title: 1st routine mammogram and alandrolic tablet

Posts.Content: Hi Julie I don't have any answers for u but I do sympathise I'm the same one minute I'm hot then I'm cold !!!! But for me it's the joint pain that gets to me most the side effects of letrozole ...  but I know some ladies on here unfortunately are suffering more than me..  hopefully someone will be able to help you. Best of luck Lou xxx
Posts.Title: Very bad flushes

Posts.Content: Hi chloecat so happy for you...  enjoy yr break u deserve one... Let's hope the sun shines tomorrow  Lou xx
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi snowy mum Congratulations I'm so happy for you.  Keep up the good work !!! Lol I too have never spoken to my bcn but I understand that most are lovely caring people...  Keep giving wonderful advice . Take care. Lou xxx
Posts.Title: 1st Annual mammo clear.....I am so happy

Posts.Content: Hi dulcie Once again yr post was very emotional for me I feel the same you brought tears to my eyes (in a good way) !!! Lol  keep strong. Take care  Lou xx
Posts.Title: how can you not detect a 30 mm tumour!

Posts.Content: Hi Scotland 13 I'm sorry to hear yr in such pain... but no I didn't need a tens machine. Are you on full meds ? I had paracetamol 4 times a day plus ibuprofen and codeine but only had those in emergencies. Hope you get yr pain under control soon. Lou x
Posts.Title: Tens machine

Posts.Content: Thanks Helen I will do. Lou xx
Posts.Title: help what are these throbbing pains ?

Posts.Content: Happy easter to my on line friends... my first letrozole brand was accord made me feel sick, dizzy, hot flushes and a few ache and pains. 2nd brand was teva which I suffered more aches and pains, terrible night sweats but no hot flushes, now ive been taking sun pharmaceutical for about a week I have almost constant hot flushes, dizzy spells and terrible limb pains mostly when I'm relaxing the pains are aching and stabbing pains .. should I continue until I get used to it or go to gps... ? The pain is throbbing mainly in my arms has anyone else had these due to tablets ? Or do you think it might be connected to my other health problems that I'm having a MRI scan for ?  I'm so confused I'm sure it will all become clearer soon.  Sending hugs at easter time. Lou xxx
Posts.Title: help what are these throbbing pains ?

Posts.Content: Hi hope everyone are enjoying their Sunday. .. does anyone know of a good website I can purchase a prosthetic breast... I was given one 6 months ago from the NHS but I'm not happy with the size... I'm finding it really difficult to actually buy one on line. I've looked at Anita care but unsuccessful.  Hope someone can help. Sending best wishes  Lou xxxx
Posts.Title: Buying a prosthetic breast on line.

Posts.Content: So happy had hospital appointment today for results of my heart and after a year with on going tests I haven't got angina !!!! So that's one box ticked !!! Next monday appointment for camera down the throat because of acid reflux which I really don't want to have....  2 weeks time my 1st yearly mamagram then 6 monthly check up with surgeon. So it's all still happening very nerve racking. .... but it can only get better.... Hope everyone is doing well. Lou xx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer and angina i year on.

Posts.Content: Hello I'm two years on from breast cancer and still get choked when I see these adverts..... I don't dwell and really appreciate and enjoy life but it has never left me..... I really dont know what the answer is regarding the adverts because I guess we have to be made aware of it as well. I wish you both well and a happy new year. All the best. Loupie lou xx
Posts.Title: Advert

Posts.Content: Hi everyone the consultant confirmed my mri scan as all clear !!! I'm soooo happy and relieved..... ive still got other health issues but my question is - has anyone experienced achey limbs and nerve pain due to letrozole?  I have shoulder and knee pain which flare up I'm assuming it's the meds. I have stabbing pains between my shoulder blades when I lie on my back and nerve pains ? I'm still being investigated but wondered if it was the letrozole?  It seems like one thing after the other.... apart from that I'm having much more positive days..... looking forward to next week off .... Looking forward to yr replies. Lou xxx
Posts.Title: Nerve pains and ache over body

Posts.Content: Hi stormylovesodds  I was diagnosed 7th Oct 15 had left mastectomy 1st Dec 15 I can honestly say the thought of my breast being removed in the early days was absolutely dreadful, hated the idea wanted recon straight away couldn't bear the fact of no breast.. when the bcn showed me photos tears rolled down my cheeks.... I said I would never show my husband etc..... I decided to wait for my recon due to other health problems.. but there I was in bed after the op looking at my scar straight away and it was ok I'm still me I haven't changed having my breast removed has saved my life and that's what's important... just take one step at a time. For me I was fearful of the unknown. I am strong and I keep positive... hope that's helped. Good luck and take care. Sending hugs. Lou xxx
Posts.Title: Having left sided masectomy without reconstruction in 2 weeks, please...

Posts.Content: Hi Julia your post made me smile I'm so jealous abt yr new kitchen... !!! Lol I've been waiting for mine for months living in boxes I'm normally so house proud I just close my eyes to the mess !! Lol it will be nice I keep telling myself... can't wait to make nice healthy food again  at the moment I feel like I'm camping  . The husband is taking 2 weeks off work to fit new kitchen then we're off for a week to tenerife which I'm a bit anxious abt but looking forward to the rest...happy baking. Lou xx
Posts.Title: Is An MRI Scan The Best Scan To check If The B.C. Has Spread ?
